description.narrative: The project aims to provide regulatory framework to promote Energy Efficiency in countries of the Eurasian Economic Union, namely in Armenia, Belarus, Kazakstan and Kyrgyzstan

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

1. Upgraded regulatory framework of energy appliances performance, MEPS/HEPS, is submitted to the national stakeholders in each partner country. 2. Relevant conferences and seminars are held with participation of key sector actors. 3. Mobile and stationary testing laboratories are equipped, operated in Armenia and Kyrgyzstan. 4. Specialists of the mobile and stationary testing laboratories are trained accordingly in Armenia and Kyrgyzstan. 5. The web-portal established in 2018 is updated regularly and upgraded as necessary. 6. Roadmap of energy efficiency and energy saving mainstreaming measures outlined and circulated. 7. Reports on consumer group analysis produced and circulated. 8. Reviews/analytical notes produced and provided to the respective partners covering the investment projects relevant to energy efficiency and energy saving in lighting and engineering equipment of buildings.

Annual: 1. The project enable EAEU regulatory framework’s active discussion both in the beneficiary countries and between the countries. The final draft of the framework was developed, submitted to and approved by the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council. 2. Two concluding seminars were held, one in Bishkek in November and the other in Yerevan in December. Fourteen experts from five countries took part in Russian Energy Week 2019 Annual International Forum in Moscow, in October. 3. Calibration of the modern equipment at the newly established photometric laboratories in Yerevan and Bishkek is performed. 4. Training and capacity building activities for the photometric laboratories and the mobile lighting laboratory are completed by the specifically hired international technical expert. 5. The project web-site www.eaeueneff.org has been continuously updated. 6. In the framework of regionalization of #togetherbrighter (#вместеярче) regional initiative, 40 high school students from Armenia, Kyrgyzstan, Belarus and Kazakhstan took part in energy efficiency school at Smena child center in Russia. 7. Social opinion survey is completed on perception of energy efficiency related information in the major retail chains of Armenia. The respective report is elaborated and submitted. Based on the findings, a concept of awareness raising activities is developed . 8. Study of energy efficiency financing mechanisms completed in Belarus similarly to the studies in Armenia and Kyrgyzstan. Catalog of best practices of investment projects in energy efficiency is completed.
Quarter 3: 1. The project enable EAEU regulatory framework’s active discussion both in the beneficiary countries and between the countries. The final draft of the framework was developed, submitted to and approved by the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council. 2. Fourteen experts from five countries took part in Russian Energy Week 2019 Annual International Forum in Moscow, in October. 3. Modern equipment is delivered for the photometric laboratory in Armenia, installed and tested, establishment of the photrometric laboratory in Kyrgyzstan and the mobile lighting laboratory Armenia is completed, all the three are operational. 4. Training and capacity building activities for the photometric laboratories and the mobile lighting laboratory are completed by the specifically hired international technical expert. 5. The project web-site www.eaeueneff.org has been continuously updated. 6. In the framework of regionalization of #togetherbrighter (#вместеярче) regional initiative, participation of 40 high school students from Armenia, Kyrgyzstan, Belarus and Kazakhstan in energy efficiency school at Smena child center in Russia is under preparation. 7. Social opinion survey is completed on perception of energy efficiency related information in the major retail chains of Armenia. The respective report is elaborated and submitted. Based on the findings, a concept of awareness raising activities is developed . 8. Study of energy efficiency financing mechanisms in Armenia and Kyrgyzstan completed and a similar study is underway in Belarus. The studies utilize the ESCo involvement into funding investment into higher energy performance in public and municipal sectors. Catalog of best practices of investment projects in energy efficiency is underway.
Quarter 2: 1. The project enable EAEU regulatory framework’s active discussion both in the beneficiary countries and between the countries. The final draft of the framework was developed to be submitted to the approval of the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council. 2. Ten experts from three countries took part in a regional event in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan, in June. Twelve experts from four countries took part in a regional event in Minsk, Belarus, in May. 3. Modern equipment delivery is underway for the photometric laboratory in Armenia, establishment of the photrometric laboratory in Kyrgyzstan and the mobile lighting laboratory Armenia is completed, both are operational. 4. Training and capacity building needs assessment is underway for the photometric laboratories and the mobile lighting laboratory. 5. The project web-site www.eaeueneff.org has been continuously updated. 6. In the framework of regionalization of #togetherbrighter (#вместеярче) regional initiative, festival events were held in Armenia and support was provided to Kyrgyzstan for similar efforts. 7. Social opinion survey is underway on perception of energy efficiency related information in the major retail chains of Armenia. Based on the findings, a concept of awareness raising activities is developed . 8. Planned for the second half of the year.
Quarter 1: 1. The project enable EAEU regulatory framework’s active discussion both in the beneficiary countries and between the countries. The final draft of the framework was developed to be submitted to the approval of the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council. 2. Two partners from Gosstandard of Belarus took part in a regional event in Tomsk, Russia. Preparatory activities held for a regional event in Minsk co-organized with Belarus. 3. Two tenders for photometric laboratory equipment were finalized in Kyrgyzstan, and the respective contracts were signed. Selection of photometric laboratory equipment supplier was finalized in Armenia with CAP meeting pending. A statement of intent with the photometric laboratory receiving organization was drafted and submitted for the parties’ approval and further signature. The tenders for equipment procurement for mobile laboratory are finalized, a specialized company was contracted to provide the specific mobile platform for the laboratory. Consultation with the key stakeholders on selection of the mobile laboratory receiving organization are ongoing. 4. Laboratory staff training will be held immediately upon the laboratories are finally transferred to the beneficiary organizations and fully equipped. 5. The project web-site www.eaeueneff.org has been continuously updated. 6. The technical assistance to regionalization/internationalization of the #togetherbrighter (#вместеярче) educational initiative was provided. The initiative’s events are extended to Armenia to be held in Lori region with schoolchildren as the key participants. 7. Social opinion survey is underway on perception of energy efficiency related information in the major retail chains of Armenia. Based on the earlier developed methodology on baseline energy consumption and GHG emission assessment, the respective national data was collected. 8. Planned for the second half of the year.
